2025.title: Linux Kernel 6.15 stable released
2025.description: Linux Kernel 6.15 introduces Rust-based NOVA DRM driver, Apple M1 improvements, new encryption features, and over 14,600 changesets.

2025.title: Linux Kernel 6.16-rc4 mainline available
2025.description: Linux Kernel 6.16-rc4, released June 29, 2025, brings new features and is now in testing for mainline integration.

2025.title: Linux Kernel 6.15.4 stable released
2025.description: Maintenance update 6.15.4 for the Linux Kernel released on June 27, 2025, addressing bugs and security fixes.

2025.title: Linux Kernel 6.14 reaches end-of-life
2025.description: Linux Kernel 6.14 officially reaches end-of-life on June 10, 2025, marking the end of maintenance updates.

2025.title: Linux Kernel 6.12.35 longterm update released
2025.description: Longterm maintenance release 6.12.35 issued on June 27, 2025, with important fixes for enterprise users.

2025.title: Scheduler enhancements improve performance
2025.description: Linux Kernel scheduler updated with better load balancing, energy efficiency, and real-time performance improvements.

2025.title: Multi-Gen LRU (MGLRU) fully integrated
2025.description: MGLRU memory management integrated into mainline kernel, reducing CPU usage and improving memory efficiency.

2025.title: Memory tiering support added
2025.description: Kernel adds memory tiering prioritizing DRAM over NVMe for high-performance computing and data centers.

2025.title: Hardware-wrapped inline encryption keys introduced
2025.description: New kernel feature for transparent disk encryption using hardware-wrapped keys enhances security.

2025.title: Expanded support for Apple M1 and Nvidia GPUs
2025.description: Linux kernel improves hardware compatibility for Apple M1 SoCs and Nvidia RTX GPUs.

2025.title: First Rust-based driver (NOVA) lands in mainline kernel
2025.description: NOVA DRM driver written in Rust merged into Linux kernel 6.15, marking a milestone for Rust in kernel development.

2025.title: FUSE now supports filenames longer than 1024 characters
2025.description: Filesystem in Userspace (FUSE) updated to handle very long filenames, improving compatibility.

2025.title: EROFS filesystem gets 48-bit block addressing
2025.description: Enhanced Read-Only File System (EROFS) now supports larger storage addressing for enterprise use.

2025.title: OverlayFS adds override_creds mount option
2025.description: OverlayFS gains new mount option to override credentials, improving container and sandbox security.

2025.title: Zero-copy receive (zcrx) via io_uring introduced
2025.description: New io_uring feature enables direct network packet transfer to userspace, boosting network performance.

2025.title: Security hook for io_uring added
2025.description: Kernel security modules gain new hook for io_uring, enhancing control over asynchronous I/O operations.

2025.title: New TCP socket options for IPv4 retry timeouts
2025.description: Kernel adds fine-grained TCP socket options to control IPv4 retry timeouts for better network reliability.

2025.title: Btrfs gets real-time zstd compression and smarter fallback
2025.description: Btrfs filesystem improves compression and I/O fallback mechanisms for better performance and reliability.

2025.title: Live patching support expanded for enterprise distros
2025.description: Enterprise Linux distributions enhance live kernel patching capabilities to reduce downtime and improve security.

2025.title: Linux Kernel receives over 75,000 commits in one year
2025.description: The Linux kernel project surpasses 75,000 commits in 2024–2025, reflecting rapid development pace.

2025.title: Critical SUSE Linux kernel security update issued
2025.description: SUSE releases critical security patches for Linux kernel addressing multiple vulnerabilities.

2025.title: SUSE Live Patch 50 for SLE 15 SP3 released
2025.description: SUSE announces Live Patch 50, enabling zero-downtime kernel updates for SLE 15 SP3 users.

2025.title: Record number of Linux kernel CVEs disclosed in 2025
2025.description: 2025 sees an unprecedented number of Linux kernel security vulnerabilities reported, driving enhanced security focus.

2025.title: Two critical sudo vulnerabilities patched across major distros
2025.description: Major Linux distributions patch two critical vulnerabilities in sudo, preventing privilege escalation attacks.

2025.title: Automated and live patching adoption increases in enterprise
2025.description: Enterprises increasingly adopt automated live patching solutions to improve Linux system security and uptime.

2025.title: Ubuntu 25.04 released
2025.description: Ubuntu 25.04 ships with GNOME 48, Linux kernel 6.14, a new security center, and updated desktop experience.

2025.title: Fedora 42 released
2025.description: Fedora 42 introduces the new Anaconda Web UI installer, GNOME 48, and improved developer tooling.

2025.title: Fedora 43 in development; plans to drop UEFI boot on MBR
2025.description: Fedora 43 development underway with plans to discontinue UEFI boot support on MBR partitioned disks.

2025.title: Debian 13 “Trixie” installer RC2 released
2025.description: Debian 13 'Trixie' installer RC2 adds Btrfs rescue support and moves closer to a stable release.

2025.title: Arch Linux July 2025 ISO released
2025.description: Arch Linux releases its July 2025 ISO, featuring kernel 6.15 and an improved installation experience.

2025.title: Zorin OS 18 released
2025.description: Zorin OS 18, based on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS, launches with new features and a refined user experience.

2025.title: Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS launches with COSMIC desktop
2025.description: System76 releases Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS with a Rust-based COSMIC desktop, focusing on customization and performance.

2025.title: openSUSE Tumbleweed continues rapid rolling releases
2025.description: openSUSE Tumbleweed maintains its position as a stable rolling release with automated testing and frequent updates.

2025.title: openSUSE Leap offers enterprise-grade LTS stability
2025.description: openSUSE Leap provides long-term support and enterprise-grade stability for production environments.

2025.title: Manjaro updates with latest KDE Plasma and GNOME
2025.description: Manjaro Linux releases updates featuring KDE Plasma 6.4.x and GNOME 48, improving user experience and hardware support.

2025.title: Linux Mint continues popularity with Cinnamon desktop
2025.description: Linux Mint remains a top choice for user-friendly Linux with its lightweight Cinnamon desktop and update management.

2025.title: Elementary OS refines macOS-like interface
2025.description: Elementary OS continues to enhance its simple and elegant desktop experience, favored by new Linux users.

2025.title: Critical Sudo vulnerabilities patched across distros
2025.description: Two critical sudo vulnerabilities patched, preventing privilege escalation on multiple Linux distributions.

2025.title: Nvidia ships over 1 billion RISC-V cores
2025.description: Nvidia announces shipment milestone of over 1 billion RISC-V cores, boosting open hardware adoption.

2025.title: TUXEDO Stellaris 16 Gen7 Linux laptop launched
2025.description: TUXEDO releases Stellaris 16 Gen7 with AMD Ryzen 9 9955HX, showing strong Linux hardware support.

2025.title: Valve Steam Client update improves Linux gaming
2025.description: Valve updates Steam client with better support for Linux gaming and Proton compatibility layers.

2025.title: Google donates Agent 2 Agent (A2A) protocol to Linux Foundation
2025.description: Google transfers A2A protocol to Linux Foundation, enhancing AI and cloud interoperability standards.

2025.title: OpenSSF releases Model Signing v1.0
2025.description: OpenSSF launches Model Signing v1.0 to secure open source AI models with cryptographic signatures.

2025.title: Overture Maps Foundation surpasses 1 billion POIs
2025.description: Open mapping project Overture Maps hits 1 billion points of interest, strengthening open geospatial data.

2025.title: Cloudflare adds C2PA support for content authenticity
2025.description: Cloudflare integrates C2PA standard to verify provenance and authenticity of web content.

2025.title: Tazama launches open source financial fraud prevention tool
2025.description: Tazama is an open source solution targeting real-time financial fraud detection in developing regions.

2025.title: Oxx publishes 'Rising Stars of Open Source 2025' report
2025.description: Venture firm Oxx highlights promising open source AI and developer tool projects for 2025.

2025.title: Fair Package Manager Project for WordPress debuts
2025.description: New open source package manager for WordPress improves plugin and theme management workflows.

2025.title: CNCF launches GitJobs open source jobs platform
2025.description: Cloud Native Computing Foundation introduces GitJobs, a job platform for cloud-native professionals.

2025.title: CentOS 7 reaches end-of-life
2025.description: CentOS 7 reaches official end-of-life, encouraging users to migrate to AlmaLinux, Rocky Linux, or Oracle Linux.

2025.title: AlmaLinux and Rocky Linux gain adoption as RHEL alternatives
2025.description: Community-driven AlmaLinux and Rocky Linux see growing adoption as stable RHEL-compatible distros.

2025.title: DebConf 2025 held in France
2025.description: Debian community gathers in France for DebConf 2025, focusing on Debian ecosystem improvements.

2025.title: GUADEC 2025 GNOME conference in Italy
2025.description: GNOME community meets in Italy for GUADEC 2025 to discuss desktop environment advancements.

2025.title: SciPy 2025 Conference showcases Python in open science
2025.description: SciPy 2025 held in the US, highlighting Python's role in scientific computing and data analysis.

2025.title: Beam Summit 2025 in New York focuses on Apache Beam
2025.description: Apache Beam community gathers to discuss open data processing and cloud-native workflows.

2025.title: Linux OS market projected to reach $9.1B in 2025
2025.description: The Linux operating system market is forecasted to grow significantly, driven by enterprise and cloud adoption.

2025.title: Linux powers 45% of global server OSes
2025.description: Linux continues dominance in server environments, powering nearly half of all global servers.

2025.title: Ubuntu holds 27.7% Linux desktop market share
2025.description: Ubuntu remains the leading Linux desktop distribution globally with over a quarter market share.

2025.title: Linux used by 47.7% of top 1,000 websites
2025.description: Nearly half of the top 1,000 websites run on Linux-based servers, showing web dominance.

2025.title: Immutable Linux distros gain popularity
2025.description: Immutable Linux distributions, like Snap-based Ubuntu, rise in adoption for enhanced security and stability.

2025.title: RISC-V-powered Linux servers gain traction
2025.description: Open hardware RISC-V architecture sees growing adoption in Linux server and embedded markets.

2025.title: Systemd codebase nears 1.3 million lines
2025.description: Systemd continues to grow in complexity and features, nearing 1.3 million lines of code.

2025.title: Expanded kernel support for Apple Touch Bar and Samsung Galaxy Book
2025.description: Linux kernel adds improved hardware support for Apple Touch Bar and Samsung Galaxy Book devices.

2025.title: Btrfs smarter fallback for direct I/O with checksums
2025.description: Btrfs filesystem enhances reliability with smarter fallback mechanisms for direct I/O operations.

2025.title: Transparent disk encryption with hardware-wrapped keys
2025.description: New kernel features enable transparent disk encryption using hardware-wrapped inline keys.

2025.title: Real-time zstd compression in Btrfs
2025.description: Btrfs adds real-time zstd compression levels, improving performance and storage efficiency.

2025.title: Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) NOVA driver for Nvidia RTX GPUs
2025.description: Rust-based NOVA DRM driver improves GPU support and security for Nvidia RTX cards in Linux.

2025.title: Improved kernel memory management for large systems
2025.description: Linux kernel optimizes memory management for large-scale systems and high-performance workloads.

2025.title: Linux Mint remains popular with Cinnamon desktop
2025.description: Linux Mint continues to be a leading user-friendly Linux distribution with its lightweight Cinnamon desktop and robust update management.

2025.title: Elementary OS enhances macOS-like interface
2025.description: Elementary OS refines its simple and elegant desktop experience, favored by new Linux users worldwide.

2025.title: Copyleft-next project relaunched
2025.description: The copyleft-next project, aimed at developing a next-generation copyleft license, has been relaunched to address modern FOSS licensing needs.

2025.title: Netdev Foundation launched to support Linux networking
2025.description: The Netdev Foundation, under the Linux Foundation, was created to financially support Linux networking development and infrastructure.

2025.title: OpenSSF 2025 Policy Summit addresses software supply chain security
2025.description: The Open Source Security Foundation hosted its 2025 Policy Summit focusing on AI security, supply chain governance, and global regulatory alignment.

2025.title: OpenSSF launches Cybersecurity Skills Framework
2025.description: OpenSSF and Linux Foundation Education released a global guide to map IT job roles to essential cybersecurity skills.

2025.title: OpenSSF OSPS Baseline helps projects align with EU Cyber Resilience Act
2025.description: OpenSSF introduced the OSPS Baseline, a maintainer-focused framework to help open source projects meet regulatory requirements.

2025.title: OpenSSF Best Practices Working Group publishes update guide
2025.description: A new guide simplifies software component updates to reduce security risks in open source projects.

2025.title: Open source community advocates for stable CVE/CWE programs
2025.description: Leaders from OpenSSF, OWASP, and Linux Foundation call for a stable, global approach to vulnerability enumeration.

2025.title: OpenSSF Community Days held in Japan and North America
2025.description: Security and open source experts gathered at OpenSSF Community Day events to share best practices and collaborate.

2025.title: Linux Foundation Member Summit 2025 fosters collaboration
2025.description: The Linux Foundation Member Summit brought together members to advance open source strategy and investment.

2025.title: FIRST VulnCon 2025 strengthens vulnerability management
2025.description: OpenSSF sponsored FIRST VulnCon, focusing on improving global vulnerability management ecosystems.

2025.title: RSA Conference 2025 highlights open source security
2025.description: OpenSSF and Linux Foundation participated in RSA Conference to address evolving cybersecurity challenges.

2025.title: OpenSearch 3.0 released with enhanced AI-driven performance
2025.description: OpenSearch 3.0 delivers a 9.5x performance improvement and improved vector database capabilities.

2025.title: ByteDance, DataStax join OpenSearch Software Foundation
2025.description: Major companies join OpenSearch Foundation as General Members, expanding ecosystem support.

2025.title: Python programs access new Linux kernel features
2025.description: Developers demonstrate how Python can interact with new kernel features immediately after release.

2025.title: Fedora i686 support reprieved after community pushback
2025.description: Fedora withdraws proposal to drop 32-bit x86 support, preserving gaming and development workflows.

2025.title: Rust driver for Asix AX88796B Ethernet controller
2025.description: A simple Rust-based Linux kernel driver demonstrates differences from C and encourages Rust adoption.

2025.title: LLMs assist Linux kernel development
2025.description: Large language models are explored to assist kernel development tasks and improve code quality.

2025.title: Bcachefs removal drama in Linux kernel
2025.description: Linus Torvalds drops Bcachefs support after disagreements, stirring debate in the community.

2025.title: EU debates need for its own Linux distribution
2025.description: Discussions arise on whether the EU should develop a modular Linux distro for public sector use.

2025.title: Open Source Initiative plans expansion in 2025
2025.description: OSI announces plans to add resources supporting developers, entrepreneurs, and legal frameworks for open source.

2025.title: Jonathan Bryce discusses open source cloud infrastructure
2025.description: Linux Foundation executive director shares insights on cloud and infrastructure open source trends.

2025.title: OpenLogic 2025 State of Open Source report
2025.description: Report highlights corporate FOSS adoption trends and challenges, revealing a complex landscape.

2025.title: GNU HHIS 5.0 released
2025.description: GNU HHIS 5.0 brings new features and improvements to the GNU project ecosystem.

2025.title: Rust 1.88.0 released
2025.description: Rust programming language version 1.88.0 introduces new features and performance enhancements.

2025.title: Oracle Linux 10 announced
2025.description: Oracle announces Oracle Linux 10 with updated kernel and enterprise features.

2025.title: PostmarketOS 25.06 released
2025.description: PostmarketOS 25.06 update brings improvements to mobile Linux distributions.

2025.title: Firefox 140.0 released
2025.description: Mozilla Firefox 140.0 introduces new features and security improvements.

2025.title: NLnet Foundation funds open source projects
2025.description: NLnet Foundation announces new grants to support open source software development.

2025.title: Linux Foundation Newsletter March 2025
2025.description: The Linux Foundation newsletter highlights open source events, projects, and initiatives for March 2025.
